text: Not only is CrossCode my favorite game of 2018, but it's not even close. I still remember last year with Hollow Knight being my favorite game of 2017, I was perplexed to see it fly under so many radars. The Switch release changed everything and with CrossCode set to release on Nintendo's console as well, I hope it gets the same huge boost of attention it deserves. CrossCode takes the best parts of Secret of Mana, Zelda, Lufia II and Wild Arms dungeons, then mixes that with awesome fast paced combat inside a MMORPG setting. The result is nothing short of incredible. Even outside traversal is filled with parkour puzzles to reach the various chests and it's so much fun that I wanted to get all of them (made pleasant by a chests counter in each area). The soundtrack and the pixel graphics feel simply perfect. Even the story is intriguing and full of likable characters, including great humor. Really, I have a hard time finding negatives for this one and I still think about the game which I will surely return to as they release more quests and expansions (just like a MMORPG). I don't say this easily, but to me CrossCode is nothing short of a masterpiece and just like with Hollow Knight before it, my favorite game of the year is now one of my favorites of all time.
author: SupraDarky

author: pholtos

text: it also had one of if not THE best early access development cycle I've ever seen for a video game. the dev were always open with everything, every delay was explained and we had a clear and concise roadmap to follow until release with monthly updates that were always on point. I cannot state how refreshing that was. this game and slay the spire(another great game that had a great early access) are both shining examples of what an early access dev cycle should be.

author: Saint Boot

text: Well, just played 50h on this game, and i can't find it more than "meh", i really enjoyed the  first half, and felt kinda annoyed all along the second half... and really, i didn't expect to see a track of ths game on your channel : having played video games for 25 years now and it's one of the few game for which i cut off the music to play another's game soundtrack. even this track, autumn's fall, maybe one of the best track of this game, is really not that great :it becomes annoying really fast, considering the time you spend on each section of the game. even my girlfriend doing something else beside me on the same room told me it was one of the most annoying soundtrack she heard EVER, and i kinda agree with here, having played a shitloads of games with absolutely brillant soundtrack.   And beside that : a bestiary of 20 differents monsters throught the game, a plot which is ... well, decent at best, the level design has problems i cant' explain well as a non-native english speaker (it's frequently difficult to see on which height you can or will land when jumping, and it's REALLY annoying a lots of time during the game)... In fact, the problem with crosscode is that it has a lot of very good idea, and a lot of really annoying ones. GOTY 2018 ? certainly not. it's at least way too long for it's own good, for what it has to offer. Maybe i'm just following the hype train, but Celeste  seems so far ahead as a goty material.

It's a really great experience, trust me, get it and you won't regret it.

author: Kunstkritik

text:
The fact that no one is talking about this game even after it's been out for like almost a year is just perplexing. This was an easy goty for me last year and it was just sad that nobody has even heard of it. No big or small youtubers made any videos on it and in general it lacked the attention it deserved.

The ONLY negative part I can think of about this game is that it's almost a bit too perfect -- there aren't much things left to talk about after you finish the game because everything is wrapped up so nice n' tight. And that's hardly a negative point.

Hopefully the Switch port will set this right and the folks at RadicalFishGames will get the money and fame they need to get their next, undoubtedly great project started with a bang!
author: NaCl

text:
About the only problem I've had personally with the game so far is that some of the writing for the dialog is a cheesy or just makes me sigh and shake my head now & then. Not often, but once in a while. Like the uh..."southern accent" they were trying to go for for that one npc who gives you that plant quest.

But really, that's nowhere near enough to put a blemish on the rest of the game, which is too much fun.
